definitions.definition: An illustrated outline filled in with a solid color(s), usually only black, and intended to represent the shape of an object without revealing any other visual details; a similar appearance produced when the object being viewed is situated in relative darkness with brighter lighting behind it; a profile portrait in black, such as a shadow appears to be.
examples: I could see a silhouette of a figure looking out from the window, but I couldn't tell if it was a man or a woman.

definitions.definition: The outline of a garment as it appears on the wearer.
examples: A-line is a classic silhouette for dresses and skirts.

main_definition: An illustrated outline filled in with a solid color(s), usually only black, and intended to represent the shape of an object without revealing any other visual details; a similar appearance produced when the object being viewed is situated in relative darkness with brighter lighting behind it; a profile portrait in black, such as a shadow appears to be. [mid 19th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( fashion ) The outline of a garment as it appears on the wearer.
